title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.43 | 13-03-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyanati Mirandasya Gyananjani Shalakaya Chakshurun Militam Jena Tasvai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and invocations, setting a spiritual tone.

segments.key_quote: You are the Almighty God and I offer you my respectful obeisances.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the 43rd verse of the 8th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, which is Queen Kunti's prayer to Krishna, and explains the meaning of the verse, highlighting Krishna's various attributes and roles.

segments.key_quote: Actually the kings are meant to rule over the citizens exactly as the representative of Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Srila Prabhupada's explanation of the verse, discussing Krishna's transcendental abode, his pastimes, his role in maintaining the universe, and the responsibility of kings to act as representatives of Krishna.

themes: Welfare of Cows, Brahmanas, and Devotees
segments.key_quote: Krishna creates, maintains and annihilates by his unlimited energies.
segments.summary: The speaker continues to explain Krishna's energies and how he works through them, emphasizing that Krishna is always full of prowess. He also highlights the importance of cows, brahmanas, and devotees for the general welfare of all living beings.

segments.key_quote: So, Kunti wants to please Krishna by addressing him in his relationship with his intimate devotees.
segments.summary: The speaker analyzes Kunti Devi's different forms of address to Lord Krishna in her prayer, focusing on the term 'Krishna Sakha' and explaining how addressing Krishna in relation to his intimate devotees is pleasing to him.

segments.key_quote: Krishna specially saved Draupadi and just Draupadi had to call out Krishna's name Govinda please say me that's all Krishna immediately responded
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Krishna's relationship with Draupadi, his appearance in the Vrishni dynasty, and his role in relieving the earth's burden by destroying demoniac kings.

segments.key_quote: King is meant to be the representative of God
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the role of a king as the representative of God, emphasizing Krishna's supremacy and the importance of devotional service for understanding God, contrasting it with the impersonal conception.
